name: illustriously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is famous, well respected, and admired: He took office eager to limit the powers of the country's illustriously educated civil servants. He has worn outfits by all the top designers during his illustriously well-dressed career.
More examplesFewer examplesSimilar work on folk sagas and traditional epics has been done before, perhaps most illustriously by scholars of classical Greece.The building had previously served as an embassy, and somewhat less illustriously as an onion store.No school gymnasium can be so illustriously lined with old team photographs.
